com.idontchop.dating

Class UserInteractionEndpoints

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idontchop.dating.UserInteractionEndpoints

  • @RestController
public class UserInteractionEndpoints
extends java.lang.Object
    This controller handles the interactions between users controlled by the junction tables: block, favorite, like, Hide, Gift They work the same except Gift which has configurable options.
    Author:
    Nathaniel J Dunn

    • Method Detail

      • addFavorite

        @RequestMapping(value="/addFavorite",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addFavorite(@RequestParam(defaultValue="-1L")
                                                                                                       java.lang.Long target)
        This adds a favorite for the current user. Favorites are a oneway linking tool by the user to keep track of certain users. This tool will likely be linked to by a drop down. It is not the same as liking which is two-way.
        Parameters:
        target - the id of user to link to as favorite
        principal - the current user's security information
        Returns:

      • addBlock

        @RequestMapping(value="/addBlock",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addBlock(@RequestParam(defaultValue="-1L")
                                                                                                 java.lang.Long target)
        Adds a block for the current user. Blocks are checked on all searches and excludes the pair. Works two-way.
        Parameters:
        target - The blocked user
        Returns:
        see addInteraction

      • addHide

        @RequestMapping(value="/addHide",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addHide(@RequestParam(defaultValue="-1L")
                                                                                               java.lang.Long target)
        Adds a Hide for the current user. Hides are used so an unliked user is not shown in a search, but hides do not block interactions between the users. Hides can be toggled when performing a new search.
        Parameters:
        target - The hidden user
        Returns:
        see addInteraction

      • addLike

        @RequestMapping(value="addLike",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addLike(@RequestParam(defaultValue="-1L")
                                                                                              java.lang.Long target)
        Adds a Like for the current user. Likes are used when the user wants to connect with the user but does not wish to do a more noticable interaction. Likes must be mutual for free messaging
        Parameters:
        target - The liked user
        Returns:
        see addInteraction
